meta.explain: Chapter discusses the protection of apprentices, stating that employers should not mistreat or have apprentices do unrelated work. The focus is on acquiring technical skills and not on domestic tasks. The chapter emphasizes the importance of providing a safe and conducive environment for apprentices to learn and develop their skills.

content.content: An employer shall neither maltreat training workers, probational workers, or other workers, regardless of their titles, whose objective is to acquire technical skills, nor have them do his/her own domestic works or other works not related to the acquisition of technical skills.
